column2: NORTH DAKOTA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: ND

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. To enter a freeway:
column4: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column6: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column8: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column10: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.

column2: 2. Passing is prohibited:
column6: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.
column8: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.

column2: 3. Road rage and aggressive driving may be caused by:
column6: tailgating.
column8: speeding.

column2: 4. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column6: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.
column8: Never.

column2: 5. The effect that alcohol has on your judgment:
column4: is less if you were only drinking wine.
column6: is less if you were only drinking beer.
column8: is greater if you were drinking hard liquor.
column10: depends on the amount of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: Persons with Disabilities Parking
column8: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 7. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column6: Call the police.
column8: Run away.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column6: School zone ahead
column8: Construction zone ahead

column2: 9. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: a winding road.
column8: a low place in the road.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column6: Right turn permitted on red light
column8: Drivers must turn right

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: Flagger ahead
column8: Side Road

column2: 12. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.
column6: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column8: before you enter the intersection.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column6: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.
column8: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.

column2: 14. If you drive much slower than the posted speed limit you:
column6: are driving safely and can avoid tailgaters.
column8: always have the right of way.

column2: 15. Drivers should always look carefully for motorcycles before changing lanes because:
column4: motorcycles are not permitted to share traffic lanes.
column6: motorcycles always have the right-of-way at intersections.
column8: motorcycles are smaller and harder to see.

column2: 16. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: stop and wait for the light to change.
column10: proceed with caution through the intersection.

column2: 17. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column6: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.
column8: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column10: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.

column2: 18. A yellow arrow used to control turns from a specific traffic lane:
column4: means the same as a circular yellow light for the lane of traffic indicated by the arrow.
column6: means that you may go in the direction indicated by the arrow.
column8: is never used as a traffic signal.
column10: is warning the traffic a green arrow is about to be shown.

column2: 19. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column6: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.
column8: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column10: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 20. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: when you first see the exit sign.
column6: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column8: before moving into the exit lane.
column10: once you see the toll booth.

column2: 21. Driving at night requires increased caution because:
column6: traffic is faster.
column8: traffic is heavier.

column2: 22. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
column6: steady red
column8: flashing green

column2: 23. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.
column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column8: Danger ahead.

column2: 24. This sign means:
column4: no turns are allowed on this road.
column6: series of curves ahead.
column8: the road may be slippery when wet.

column2: 25. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column6: Turn on your cruise control.
column8: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column10: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
